ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Stellar Dynamics is a must take for any student in the astronomy department, and should be a required course. Even if you are not interested in dynamics, it has applications to a lot of different parts of astronomy, especially exoplanets and galaxies. The topics covered in this course will be useful for any field of astronomy. You can't take it without understanding that it will be a huge time commitment, which Marla quite clearly conveyed in the first lecture.
I would suggest that this course be required all graduate students, or at least that its model be applied to other classes.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course more than any other has deepened my knowledge of astronomy. I find myself understanding colloquiums and talks much better because of this course. Amazing course and amazing topics!
This course connects to many other relevant areas of astronomy, and also required / helped develop general skills that are relevant to the field as a whole.
